title: Tavily AI Summary
content: Tesla's revenue growth is strong, with a 5-year CAGR of 29.2%, and it has a healthy cash position of $36.8B. The company's valuation metrics are high, reflecting growth expectations.

title: Tesla Stock Analysis 2025 - Undervalued or Overvalued?
content:
The growth metrics that have driven Tesla's stratospheric valuation remain impressive, though showing signs of maturation:

### Revenue Growth Analysis

Historical Performance:

 5-Year Revenue CAGR: 29.2% (remarkable sustained growth)
 2024 Revenue Actual: $97.69B (up from $96.77B in 2023)
 Forward Revenue Growth: Projected 14.8% over next two years

### Profitability Evolution [...] ### Financial Health: A Mixed Bag

Positive Indicators:

 Debt-to-Equity: 9.2% (exceptionally strong balance sheet)
 Cash Position: $36.8B in cash and short-term investments
 Net Debt: Negative $29.6B (net cash position)

Concerning Metrics:

 FCF Yield: 0.5% (minimal free cash flow relative to market cap)
 EBIT/Interest: 29.1x (while strong, reflects limited current profitability)

## Tesla's Growth Trajectory: The Bull Case Foundation [...] EV/Revenue: 11.1x (significantly above traditional automotive multiples)
 EV/EBIT: 183.5x (extremely elevated compared to industry standards)
 P/E Ratio: 175.0x (ref
raw_content:
# Tesla Stock Forecast: Is TSLA Undervalued or Overvalued? - 2025 Analysis

**Welcome to the Value Sense Blog**, your resource for insights on the stock market! At Value Sense, we focus on intrinsic value tools and offer stock ideas with undervalued companies. Dive into our research products and learn more about our unique approach atÂ [valuesense.io](http://valuesense.io/?ref=blog.valuesense.io)

Explore diverse stock ideas covering technology, healthcare, and commodities sectors. Our insights are crafted to help investors spot opportunities in undervalued growth stocks, enhancing potential returns. Visit us to see evaluations and in-depth market research.

[Get 50+ undervalued stocks for free](https://valuesense.io/?ref=blog.valuesense.io)

---

The eternal question surrounding Tesla (TSLA) continues to captivate investors and analysts alike: Is this electric vehicle pioneer trading at a justified premium, or has the market gotten carried away? At [ValueSense](https://valuesense.io/?ref=blog.valuesense.io), we've conducted a comprehensive analysis of [Tesla's latest financial data,](https://valuesense.io/ticker/tsla?ref=blog.valuesense.io) competitive positioning, and market dynamics to provide clarity on one of the most polarizing stocks in the market.

The numbers tell a complex story. With aÂ [**$1.061 trillion market capitalization**](https://valuesense.io/ticker/tsla/market-cap?ref=blog.valuesense.io)Â and [multiple valuation models](https://valuesense.io/ticker/tsla/intrinsic-value?ref=blog.valuesense.io) screaming "overvalued," Tesla presents both compelling growth prospects and significant valuation concerns that demand careful examination.

## The Valuation Reality Check: What the Numbers Say

Our comprehensive analysis reveals a stark disconnect between Tesla's current market price and traditional valuation methodologies. The data is unequivocal:Â **Tesla appears to be trading at a 94.5% premium to its** [**intrinsic value**](https://valuesense.io/ticker/tsla/intrinsic-value?ref=blog.valuesense.io)Â of $18.1 per share, based on discounted cash flow analysis.

### Valuation Metrics That Demand Attention

**Enterprise Value Multiples Paint an Expensive Picture**:  
([https://valuesense.io/ticker/tsla#key-stats](https://valuesense.io/ticker/tsla?ref=blog.valuesense.io#key-stats))

* **EV/Revenue**: 11.1x (significantly above traditional automotive multiples)
* **EV/EBIT**: 183.5x (extremely elevated compared to industry standards)
* **P/E Ratio**: 175.0x (reflecting high growth expectations)
* **P/FCF**: 187.8x (indicating substantial premium for cash generation)

These multiples place Tesla in rarefied air, typically reserved for high-growth technology companies rather than automotive manufacturers. The question becomes: can Tesla's business fundamentals justify these premium valuations?

### Financial Health: A Mixed Bag

**Positive Indicators**:

* **Debt-to-Equity**: 9.2% (exceptionally strong balance sheet)
* **Cash Position**: $36.8B in

title: Tesla (TSLA) Research Report
content: Although Tesla hasnâ€™t been the highest-quality company lately, it found a few growth initiatives in the past that worked out wonderfully. Its five-year average ROIC was 29.2%, splendid for an industrials business. [...] Tesla shows that fast growth and massive scale can coexist despite conventional wisdom. The companyâ€™s revenue base of $25.71 billion five years ago has more than tripled to $92.72 billion in the last year, translating into an incredible 29.2% annualized growth rate. [...] Switching to Energy, revenue grew at a fantastic five-year pace, clocking in at 48.8% annualized. This performance, like Services, trumped its total revenue growth by 19.6 percentage points. On a two-year basis, growth was 41.6%. This is slower than its five-year rate, but itâ€™s impressive nonetheless as it worked off a $5.47 billion revenue base.

title: Tesla Valuation Debate Intensifies as Fundamentals Slow ...
content:
While financial metrics soften, bullish analysts continue to reframe NASDAQ:TSLA as an AI-driven autonomy platform rather than an automaker. Teslaâ€™s AI chip roadmap (AI4â€“AI6) and robotaxi economics are now central to the bullish thesis. [...] Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) trades near $431.77 on December 2, 2025, with a market capitalization of $1.35 trillion, maintaining its place as one of the worldâ€™s most polarizing equities. The stock has surged over 7% year-to-date, outperforming most EV peers, but a sharp debate has reignited around its valuation after Michael Burry renewed his short position, claiming Teslaâ€™s market cap is â€œridiculously overvalued.â€ The tension between Teslaâ€™s slowing fundamentals and its high-growth AI narrative [...] From a technical standpoint, NASDAQ:TSLA remains above its 200-day moving average, supported near $428, with short interest around 2.14%. The upper resistance zone sits between $480 and $488, representing the 52-week high.

# Tesla Stock and Capital Structure Financial Overview

By

[David Gorton](https://www.investopedia.com/contributors/54436/)

[Full Bio](https://www.investopedia.com/contributors/54436/)

David Gorton, CPA, has 5+ years of professional experience in accounting. He teaches accounting, helping promote financial education and awareness.

Learn about our 
[editorial policies](/legal-4768893#editorial-policy)

Updated November 26, 2025

Reviewed by

[Eric Estevez](https://www.investopedia.com/eric-estevez-4799782)

Reviewed by
Eric Estevez

[Full Bio](https://www.investopedia.com/eric-estevez-4799782)

Eric's career includes extensive work in both public and corporate accounting with responsibilities such as preparing and reviewing federal, state, and local tax filings; supporting multinational teams on tax compliance and financial controls; managing bookkeeping, financial statements, and month-/year-end-close; and advising business owners on financial management and operational strategy.

Learn about our 
[Financial Review Board](/investopedia-financial-review-board-5076269)

### Key Takeaways

* Tesla achieved profitability after years of expensive startup costs.
* Tesla's market share dropped from 62% in 2022 to 55% in 2023.
* The company's debt reached $43.2 billion in 2023, up from $35.7 billion in 2022.
* Tesla's debt-to-equity ratio improved to 0.68 by the end of 2023.
* Elon Musk is involved in various ventures, including SpaceX and Neuralink.

When the electric car company Tesla, Inc. (TSLA) launched its initial public offering on June 29, 2010, its shares closed the day at $23.89, a 40.5% gain over its starting price. Since that day, Tesla's path has been impressive if occasionally rocky lately.1

(To watch Louis Gerardâ€™s track record, click here) [...] On Wall Street, TSLA is firmly split, with 11 Buys, 12 Holds, and 9 Sells â€“ leaving the stock stuck with a consensus Hold (i.e., Neutral) rating.
